text:
Vernon Boulevard Bridge, spanning Newtown Creek and connecting Long Island City, Queens, with Greenpoint, Brooklyn. The bridge was built in 1904. Views 1 and 2 show the Brooklyn side of the bridge; views 2 and 3 are east along the creek.
Views 1,2:  Eugene L. Armbruster Collection  1922
Views 3,4:  P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 3: 1930
View 4: 1936
title: Bridges - Vernon Boulevard Bridge - [Newtown Creek.]

text:
Vernon Boulevard north of the N. E. corner of 37th Avenue, showing the fire house of Engine 260, New York City Fire Department.

F. L. Sperr                              November 6, 1930

Vernon Boulevard Bridge, over Newtown Creek, linking Greenpoint, Brooklyn, with Long sland City (left), Queens. The view is up the
creek.
P. L. Sperr  View 1: November 3, 1930
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 2: October 25, 1936
title: Bridges - Vernon Boulevard Bridge - [Newtown Creek.]

text:
37-21 Vernon Boulevard, east side, between 37th and 38th Avenues, showing the Winslow House. It was the E. Post house in 1873. It was a cupola on the roof.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection     April, 1925
